title: Powering the Future with Digital Electricity® ⚡ Join ...
description: Free hybrid training on Fault Managed Power Systems (FMPS) exploring how this emerging technology transforms power delivery in modern buildings.
summary: This is a promotional post for a free hybrid training event focused on Fault Managed Power Systems. The training aims to educate participants on how FMPS technology is transforming modern power delivery, making it highly relevant for FMP knowledge dissemination and industry adoption.

title: Instagram post by Alexis Bertholf explaining Fault Managed Power at Cisco Live Amsterdam
description: Social media post explaining the core principles of Fault Managed Power: high voltage, low current, continuous fault detection, and instant shutoff capabilities.
summary: An Instagram post from Cisco Live Amsterdam that provides a concise technical definition of Fault Managed Power (FMP). The post explains that FMP is characterized by high voltage, very low current, continuous fault detection, and instant shutoff when faults are detected, emphasizing the safety aspects of the technology.

title: LinkedIn post by Jason Shearer discussing FMP and Smart Building convergence at Cisco Live
description: Jason Shearer discusses growing interest in OT system convergence and Fault Managed Power at Cisco Live Amsterdam, highlighting industry momentum toward FMP adoption.
summary: Jason Shearer reports on increasing customer and partner excitement around converging OT systems onto common platforms powered by networks and higher power systems like Fault Managed Power, based on his presentation at Cisco Live Amsterdam. Comments from industry professionals highlight FMP as a game-changing technology, particularly when paired with Power over Ethernet for energy management and revolutionary architectures.

title: LinkedIn post by Ronna Davis on FMP Alliance free online training clinic
description: FMP Alliance announces free online training clinic in March covering fault managed power system design, installation, and maintenance for industry professionals.
summary: Ronna Davis, Secretary of FMP Alliance, announces a free online training clinic in March 2025 for professionals interested in learning about fault managed power systems. The clinic will cover codification, safety standards, and design architectures, responding to strong interest from the BICSI Winter event in Orlando about FMP training opportunities.

title: ELECTRI Monthly Recap for Council Members - January ...
description: ELECTRI monthly recap highlighting comparative study of Fault Managed Power vs. traditional electrical systems for temporary construction power applications.
summary: ELECTRI (Electrical Contracting Foundation's research institute) monthly update featuring a comparative study examining FMP versus traditional electrical systems specifically for temporary construction power. This research is significant for validating FMP's safety and operational advantages in construction environments.

title: VoltServer® Appoints Dave Johnson as Chief Executive Officer
description: VoltServer announces Dave Johnson as new CEO to lead fault-managed power innovation across telecom, transportation, enterprise, and industrial markets.
summary: VoltServer appointed Dave Johnson as Chief Executive Officer to lead the company's growth as the recognized leader in fault-managed power technology. This leadership change signals VoltServer's commitment to expanding FMP infrastructure solutions across telecom, transportation, enterprise, and industrial markets.

title: Fault Managed Power: Delivering up to 1 Kilowatt Over Single Twisted Pair
description: TikTok video explaining how Fault Managed Power can deliver up to a kilowatt of power over a single twisted pair using high voltage and very low current.
summary: This short-form video explains the core technical characteristics of Fault Managed Power technology. It highlights FMP's ability to deliver up to 1 kilowatt of power over a single twisted pair cable using high voltage and very low current, demonstrating the fundamental principles that differentiate FMP from traditional power delivery methods.

title: The Top Habits of High-Performing Forepersons

title: RE+ Northeast 2026: Solar Mounts LLC Recap
description: Solar Mounts LLC recaps RE+ Northeast 2026 workshop on grid capacity challenges, discussing NEC Fault-Managed Power sections and future power infrastructure.
summary: This event recap discusses a workshop at RE+ Northeast 2026 covering grid capacity challenges and the role of microgrids. The content mentions that the NEC (National Electrical Code) is adding sections on 'Fault-Managed Power' with focus on power articulation, alongside discussions of future power infrastructure needs driven by AI data centers, EVs, and other emerging loads requiring hybrid AC/DC grid systems.
